clinical_study.brief_title: Usefulness of the Chronic Obstructive Pulmonary Disease-population (COPD-PS) Questionnaire and the COPD-6 Device in the Chronic Obstructive Pulmonary Disease Detection in a Tobacco Detoxication Consultation
clinical_study.official_title: Usefulness of the Chronic Obstructive Pulmonary Disease-population (COPD-PS) Questionnaire and the COPD-6 Device in the Chronic Obstructive Pulmonary Disease Detection in a Tobacco Detoxication Consultation

lead_sponsor.agency: Fundación Pública Andaluza para la gestión de la Investigación en Sevilla

clinical_study.source: Fundación Pública Andaluza para la gestión de la Investigación en Sevilla

brief_summary.textblock: The aim of this study is to evaluate the usefulness of the chronic obstructive pulmonary disease-population questionnaire (COPD-PS) and the COPD-6 device in the early detection of chronic obstructive pulmonary disease in smoker patients .

primary_outcome.measure: Evaluate the usefulness in the COPD early detection of the combination of the COPD-PS questionnaire and the COPD-6 device.
primary_outcome.time_frame: Up to 12 months after the first consultation
primary_outcome.description: Verify if the combination of the COPDS-questionnaire (made of different items that allow the detection of chronic airflow obstruction) and the COPD-6 device (tool that measures the ventilatory capacity) is suitable for the COPD early detection.

arm_group.description: Patients appointed in a tobacco detoxication consultation

intervention.description: To verify the tobacco withdrawal, the patients will make a cooximetry. For the detection of a possible obstructive pattern a measurement of the ventilatory capacity will be make using the COPD-6 device and for the confirmation of COPD diagnosis and the assesment of the airflow obstruction severity a spirometry will be make. The patients will also complete the COPD-PS questionnaire.

study_pop.textblock: Smoker patients that are treated in the tobacco detoxication consultation

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- > 35 years old
- Accumulative tobacco rate > 10 paq-year that go to the tobacco detoxication consultation
Exclusion Criteria:
- Unable to fulfill the questionnarie
- Unable to adequately perform the COPD-6 or forced spirometry maneuvers included in the study.
- Reject to participate and sign the informed consent.

clinical_study.keyword: Chronic obstructive pulmonary disease population questionnaire
